arts.ttl: World media reacts to Celtic sin that sparked Harry Kane ‘thank you’ as Bayern Munich stumble amid ‘noise of hell’
arts.sum: it was another European thriller for the Hoops faithful but Kane and Co left Celtic Park with a vital first leg advantage

arts.ttl: Daily Schmankerl: The aftermath of Bayern Munich vs. Celtic in the Champions League; Chelsea, Manchester United eyeing Ousmane Diomande; Tottenham Hotspur, Arsenal among teams who want Harry Kane; Liverpool to get FC Barcelona star?; and MORE!
arts.sum: According to a report by Football Insider, Arsenal, Chelsea, Manchester United, and Tottenham are keeping tabs on the situation of Harry Kane, and they could look to bring him back to England. Just a few weeks ago, Bayern Munich was linked to Sporting CP defender Ousmane Diomande, but Chelsea FC and Manchester United are now rumored to be keeping a close eye:

arts.ttl: Kane: Bayern trophies take priority over NFL dream
arts.sum: Bayern Munich striker Harry Kane, fresh off a goal in his team's 2-1 Champions League victory over Celtic, reiterated his long-held ambition to eventually transition his kicking skills to the NFL.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany says the battle is won, but not the war for Bayern Munich
arts.sum: Bayern Munich is fresh off a win they struggled to achieve against Celtic, but Vincent Kompany wants to remind fans that the fight isn’t over yet. Also, be sure to stay tuned to Bavarian Podcast Works for all of your up to date coverage on Bayern Munich and Germany.

arts.ttl: Joshua Kimmich comments on his assist for Bayern Munich’s winning goal
arts.sum: On the topic of goal scoring and fixing the problems with Bayern’s attack, Kimmich also spoke on the clubs upcoming clash with Leverkusen on Saturday, a game that’s bound to be extremely entertaining. Joshua Kimmich recorded an assist tonight against Celtic in the Champions League playoffs for Bayern Munich, and Harry Kane was on the receiving end of it.

arts.ttl: Celtic take German lessons to avert 'absolute thumping'
arts.sum: After going two down to Bayern Munich, Celtic might have feared another heavy Champions League defeat. But Brendan Rodgers' side emerged beaten but "not broken".

arts.ttl: 'He never stops running' - How impressive Maeda gives Celtic 'hope' against Bayern
arts.sum: Chris Sutton and Nedum Onuoha discuss Daizen Maeda's performance against Bayern Munich after he grabbed his 22nd goal of the season to keep Celtic's Champions League hopes alive.

arts.ttl: The Verdict: Hope for Celtic after narrow Bayern loss
arts.sum: Sky Sports' Luke Shanley provides reaction to Celtic's 2-1 first leg defeat at home to Bayern Munich.
